intro: Sporobolus microspermus, commonly known as sand dropseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit and fine, thread-like leaves. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, white to pale blue flowers. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in dry, open habitats such as deserts and grasslands. Sporobolus microspermus is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy and resilient species.
